job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: strongPOSITION PURPOSEbrbrstrongThe Software Engineer is responsible for joining a product team and contributing to the software design software development and overall product lifecycle for a product that our users love The engineering process is highly collaborative Software Engineers are expected to pair on a daily basis as they work through user stories and support products as they evolvebrbrIn addition Software Engineers may be involved in product configuration performance tuning and testing as well as production monitoringbrbrAs a Software Engineer you will be part of a team with more experienced engineers to help build and grow your skills while you create support and deploy production applicationsbrbrstronguMajor Tasks Responsibilities And Key Accountabilitiesbrbrustrong60  Delivery amp ExecutionbrbrCollaborates and pairs with other product team members UX engineering and product management to create secure reliable scalable software solutionsbrbrWorks with Product Team to ensure user stories that are developerready easy to understand and testablebrbrWrites custom code or scripts to automate infrastructure monitoring services and test casesbrbrWrites custom code or scripts to do destructive testing to ensure adequate resiliency in productionbrbrConfigures commercial off the shelf solutions to align with evolving business needsbrbrCreates meaningful dashboards logging alerting and responses to ensure that issues are captured and addressed proactivelybrbr20  Support amp EnablementbrbrFields questions from other product teams or support teamsbrbrMonitors tools and participates in conversations to encourage collaboration across product teamsbrbrProvides application support for software running in productionbrbrProactively monitors production Service Level Objectives for productsbrbrProactively reviews the Performance and Capacity of all aspects of production code infrastructure data and message processingbrbr20 LearningbrbrParticipates in learning activities around modern software design and development core practices communities of practicebrbrProactively views articles tutorials and videos to learn about new technologies and best practices being used within other technology organizationsbrbrReviews and discusses code from more senior engineers to understand best practices and design patternsbrbrIncreases business acumen by learning about other parts of the businessbrbrstrongNATURE AND SCOPEbrbrstrongTypically reports to the Software Engineer Manager or Sr ManagerbrbrstronguEnvironmentbrbrustrongstrongENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTSbrbrstrongLocated in a comfortable indoor area Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionablebrbrstronguTravelbrbrustrongTypically requires overnight travel less than 10 of the timebrbrstronguMinimum QualificationsbrbrustrongMust be eighteen years of age or olderbrbrMust be legally permitted to work in the United StatesbrbrstronguAdditional Minimum QualificationsbrbrustrongExperience in an object oriented programming language preferably JavabrbrMust be legally permitted to wobrbrstronguEducation RequiredbrbrustrongThe knowledge skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diploma andor GEDbrbrstrongYears of Relevant Work Experience 12strong yearsbrbrstronguPhysical RequirementsbrbrustrongMost of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articlesbrbrstronguPreferred QualificationsbrbrustrongstrongAdditional Qualificationsbrbrstrong12 years of relevant work experiencebrbrExperience in a modern scripting language preferably PythonbrbrExposure to a modern web application framework such as Ruby on Rails Spring MVC and NodejsbrbrExposure to a frontend technology and framework such as HTML CSS JavaScript AngularJS ReactJS and JQuerybrbrExposure to writing SQL queries against a relational databasebrbrExposure to version control systems preferably GitbrbrstrongKnowledge Skills Abilities and CompetenciesstrongCultivates Innovation Creating new and better ways for the organization to be successfulbrbrCollaborates Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectivesbrbrCommunicates Effectively Developing and delivering multimode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiencesbrbrDrives Results Consistently achieving results even under tough circumstancesbrbrGlobal Perspective Taking a broad view when approaching issues using a global lensbrbrInterpersonal Savvy Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of peoplebrbrManages Ambiguity Operating effectively even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clearbrbrNimble Learning Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems using both successes and failures as learning fodderbrbrSelfDevelopment Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channelsbrbrSituational Adaptability Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations
